Drøbak was in the 19th century used as a winter port for the capital
, because the fjord froze in winter time. The most famous story is
es role during the Norwegian campaign. The 9th April 1940, the fortress sunk the German cruiser

and thus delayed the Nazi German invasion of Norway. 

Today the town is a picturesque little spot, which consists mostly of small, whitepainted wooden houses. Especially in summer, the town is used as a seaside resort for many tourists, who find many scenic attractions here.
